article_title: Losing weight after a pregnancy is vital to mom's health
article_text:
Losing weight after a pregnancy is vital to mom's health

Photo: Dimitrios Kambouris, Staff Reese Witherspoon

It took Reese Witherspoon eight weeks; Uma Thurman did it in six weeks; and Heidi Klum hit the Victoria's Secret runway only five weeks after delivering her fourth child. So, losing weight after a pregnancy isn't so tough, right?

article_metadata.author.name: By Michael Roizen, M.D., and Mehmet Oz, M.D.

og.description:
It took Reese Witherspoon eight weeks; Uma Thurman did it in six weeks; and Heidi Klum hit the Victoria's Secret runway only five weeks after delivering her fourth child. So, losing weight after a pregnancy isn't so tough, right?
Well, maybe ... if you have several trainers, a personal chef and unlimited resources. For most of you, it may be more challenging. And it's reasonable to take up to a year.
It is important, however, to lose the weight within 12 months after delivery. If you don't, you can develop what's called a cardiometabolic profile (elevated blood pressure, insulin resistance, lower good HDL cholesterol and elevated triglycerides).
og.title: Losing weight after a pregnancy is vital to mom's health

article_summary:
So, losing weight after a pregnancy isn't so tough, right?
